newsitem.title: POLAND: Zloty fixed stronger at 2.51 pct from parity rate.
newsitem.headline: Zloty fixed stronger at 2.51 pct from parity rate.

text.p: The National Bank of Poland fixed the zloty at 3.1545 to the dollar, up from 3.1565 on Wednesday, and at 1.8420 to the mark, down from 1.8365, the NBP said.
The central bank fixed the zloty at an average of 2.51 percent from the weighted dollar and mark parity rates, stronger than Wednesday's 2.49 percent fix.

According to Reuters' calculations, it was fixed at 2.51 percent from the floating parity rate, which changes in line with intraday currency movements on world markets, against yesterday's fix at 2.47 percent.
